fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28251].
  {panel}

Actually if we want just to export some pages in "Potrait" and some in "Landscape" we must put the pages in different space, because we can't have more than one stylesheet per space.
This restriction is very harmful, because often, some pages are larger than other according to table size.
[See support ticket CSP-96679 for more info|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-96679]

It would be very nice to have an option to choose Stylesheet when Exporting in PDF.
fields.summary: PDF Export : Multiple stylesheets per space

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA and Confluence and configure the base URL (with context path) for example to:
** http://10.60.1.80:8525/jira - JIRA
** http://10.60.1.80:8090/confluence - Confluence
# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
# Create a new issue in JIRA and then comment on the issue
# With a successful application link integration, you'll received notification of the comment in Confluence Workbox
# Click on the notification and you'll be directed to the issue e.g. http://10.60.1.80:8525/jira/browse/TST-56118
# Change JIRA context path/base URL to http://10.60.1.80:8525/jira1
# Re-configure application link between Confluence and JIRA with the new base URL
# Add a new comment on the existing issue in JIRA
# With a successful application link integration, you'll received notification of the new comment in Confluence Workbox
# Click on the notification and you'll not be successfully redirected to the issue because it was trying to redirect you to http://10.60.1.80:8525/jira/browse/TST-56118. Noticed that the context path does not reflect the new context path which is supposed to be "jira1"
# Clicking on the previous JIRA issue notification in Confluence Workbox also will not redirect you to the correct link as it was still pointing to the old base URL

My assumption was that this URL must have been stored somewhere in the database and updating the URL manually from the database would work as a workaround. I've checked on Confluence AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION table but JIRA notifications are not stored in an absolute path but instead like this:
{code}
/browse/TST-56118
/browse/BB-870
/browse/NCLIS-358
{code}

I then looked into Confluence BANDANA table for application link configuration (assuming that Confluence take the base URL from the configured application link) and it appears that the new JIRA base URLs (both Application URL & Display URL) are stored correctly in the database:
||bandanakey||bandanavalue||
|applinks.admin.781ddc6c-b497-38d7-8fc3-aad86127c262.display.url|<string>http://10.60.1.80:8525/jira1</string>|
|applinks.admin.781ddc6c-b497-38d7-8fc3-aad86127c262.rpc.url|<string>http://10.60.1.80:8525/jira1</string>|

Where does this URL stored or taken from?
fields.summary: Links of JIRA Issues in Confluence Workbox Notification do not get updated when JIRA base URL has changed

fields.description:
All existings labels defined in contentbylabel macro disappear after upgrading Confluence. Tested with Confluence 3.5.17 and upgraded this instance to 4.3.5

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Confluence 3.5.17
# Create a new space
# At the space home page, insert these labels: {{guide, documentation, technical}}
# Insert contentbylabel macro in the space home page:
{code}{contentbylabel:guide,technical,documentation|operator=AND|key=@self|title=Technical documentation|showLabels=false|showSpace=false|maxResults=99|excerpt=true}{code}
# Create one or two child pages and insert these labels in those pages: {{guide, documentation, technical}}
# Go to *Confluence Admin > Content Indexing > Queue Contents > Flush Queue* to ensure that the index queue is flushed
# Stop Confluence 3.5.17 and upgrade this instance to 4.3.5
# After the upgrade, visit the space that has just been created before and edit the home page of the space
# Edit the {{contentbylabel}} macro

h4. Expected Results
Labels in the {{contentbylabel}} macro should be migrated and shown after the upgrade

h4. Actual Results
Labels in the {{contentbylabel}} macro are not migrated and shown after the upgrade, as can be seen in the following screenshot (the "Labels" field is empty)
!screenshot003.jpg!

h4. Environment Information
Confluence 3.5.17 > 4.3.5
MySQL  5.1

h4. Findings
The labels exist in the following storage format:
{code}
<ac:default-parameter>guide,technical,documentation</ac:default-parameter>{code}

It should be migrated from Wiki Markup to XHTML as the following instead:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="labels">guide,technical,documentation</ac:parameter>{code}

h4. Workaround
Edit the macro and manually insert the labels again
fields.summary: All existings labels in contentbylabel macro disappear after upgrading Confluence

fields.description:
If the Documentation Theme is your global look-and-feel it is not possible to select the new default theme for an individual space.

Only work around would be to select the default theme as default, and set the documentation theme manually to all spaces, but this is a manual and painful job. 

I would expect to be able to select the new default theme for an individual space, even if the Documentation theme is default. This would make te migration a whole lot easier
fields.summary: Can't select new default theme when Documentation theme is global

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28238].
  {panel}

According to my tests with a Delegated LDAP, when a user logs in:
* We query the user's details twice
* We query the user's groups.

Environment:
* I looked at the requests with Wireshark,
* Delegated LDAP,
* Use Nested Groups (but beware of CONF-27032),
* Copy User on Login,
* Synchronize Memberships.
* See attached file: 1 group, 10 users, you'll see in the request that the 10 users appear when one logs in. [Tutorial to launch OpenLDAP on your machine|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Testing+with+OpenLDAP].

On a slow LDAP (my test instance with OpenLDAP and 100,000 users takes 18s to answer any simple query), this feels like a long login.

This issue is in Confluence but it is probably related to Embedded Crowd. I keep investigating. This is only a performance improvement.
fields.summary: The LDAP is queried twice for the user's details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28237].
  {panel}

A bug in the confluence-create-content-plugin released with Confluence 5.0 means that clicking the "Create" button in the header does not show the Create dialog as expected. Instead, the screen the user is on is reloaded.
***
Update - the cause of the bug has been identified and a fix should be released very shortly.

h3. Applying the Patch:

# Download the plugin attached to this ticket, which contains the fix for the problem.
# In Confluence, choose the cog icon at top right of the screen, then choose Confluence Admin. Then choose Add-ons > Manage Add-ons
# Click on the Upload Plugin link on the right hand side and upload the file downloaded on step 1.

fields.description:
Hi,

There is a bug which causes too many pages shown as "recently changed" on the dashboard.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
Create a page A that links to Page B in a different space.
When Page B is moved to another space, then Page A is shown as "updated" on the dashboard.
Page B is also shown as "updated".

There are many bugs here at once:
1. Page A is shown as "updated" although it was neither changed nor moved.
2. The update is shown with the picture of user "user1" although I did not change Page A.
3. There is no "what did you change" comment on the dashboard for Page A, because no one could enter a such a comment.
4. A page comparison with the previous version of page A shows no changes at all. Because their are none.
5. Page B is also shown as "updated", without any "what did you change comment".
It should rather be "moved" (makes the "what did you change" comment unnecessary.)
6. A page comparison with the previous version of page B also shows no changes at all.
7. All the subpages move when moving page A, too, but only page A is shown as "updated" on the dashboard

Either all of them or no of them should appear on the dashboard so this seems not to be logical.


When it happens automatically, then there is no change comment on the dashboard, and there is also no difference to see when comparing the page to the previous version. So the users think someone has edited the page and just saved it without changing anything. Also rather than always showing just "updated" the nature of the reason why a page is shown on the desktop should be more detailed. Also there should never be a change update shown with the logo of a person who did not change the page.


h3. Update
I was not able to reproduce the bug in 4.3.7 version of Confluence.
fields.summary: Bug Page is shown as changed, after another page that is linked from this page was moved to another space

h4. Summary
Adding a Confluence Page Gadget into JIRA Dashboard will results an internal server error, regardless of authentication types configured.

# Choose a Confluence page and Save.
# Try with other authentication type returns the same error.

h4. Screenshot
!Confluence Page Gadget.png!

h4. UPDATE
Integration between Confluence 4.0.4 and JIRA 4.4.1 will have the Confluence Page Gadget working properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28221].
  {panel}

When editing a document, Confluence thinks it's being clever by capturing ctrl-f and firing up it's own search panel. Personally I was happy with the search provided by my browser, but whatever.

The problem comes because Confluence isn't smart enough to also capture ctrl-g (search again, or find next, or whatever). So when I hit ctrl-g, the browsers search panel now opens. Typically the browser is searching for the string before last.

This is a real pain.

Could capturing ctrl-f be made optional (currently I see it isn't), or could you do the favour of also respecting ctrl-g?

kthxbi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28207].
  {panel}

This happens because of one of the following reasons:
1. Themes that are not supported by Confluence 5.0 are still applied to the instance and/or spaces.
2. The CSS customizing spaces in the previous version is not compatible with 5.0 because of the changes inserted by the [Atlassian Design Guidelines|https://developer.atlassian.com/design/].

In both cases, the problem can be fixed by following the steps suggested in Upgrade Notes:

* [Custom themes, layouts and CSS will probably break|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.0+Upgrade+Notes#Confluence5.0UpgradeNotes-Customthemes,layoutsandCSSwillprobablybreak]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28201].
  {panel}

Quite a number of our customers ran into performance issues pairing Confluence with 64-bit JRE, and using less than 2GB of heap. This is apparently a known issue documented [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Garbage+Collector+Performance+Issues#GarbageCollectorPerformanceIssues-Use32bitJREifHeap%3C2GB]. 

Problem is, that documentation is not-obvious, and customers may not be aware of it until they start hitting into issues, and finally raising support tickets to resolve it. Naturally, if I am using a 64-bit OS, I would of course, download a 64 bit Confluence Installer. (note also that Confluence 64-bit comes pre-defined with low Xmx: 512m)

My suggestion would be to put a note (to warn customers of such a performance issue with 64bit Installers) in the following areas:
# The Confluence download page (most important place)
# https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Guide
fields.summary: Performance Issue with Running Confluence 64 bit paired with less than 2G of heap

h4. Symptoms

When synchronising a directory from a user directory, it fails, with an error like the below:

{code:none}2013-02-21 09:59:32,590 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-2] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] pollChanges Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 98307 ].

  Detail: Key (parent_id, child_user_id)=(163849, 229382) already exists.; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cwd_unique_user_membership"

	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.$Proxy1476.addUserToGroup(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.addUserToGroup(DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.java:187)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseChanges(EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.java:115)

	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cwd_unique_user_membership"
  Detail: Key (parent_id, child_user_id)=(163849, 229382) already exists.
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2102)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1835)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:257)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:500)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeWithFlags(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:388)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeUpdate(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:334)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:105)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.NonBatchingBatcher.addToBatch(NonBatchingBatcher.java:22)
	at net.sf.hibernate.persister.EntityPersister.insert(EntityPersister.java:462)
	at net.sf.hibernate.persister.EntityPersister.insert(EntityPersister.java:436)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.ScheduledInsertion.execute(ScheduledInsertion.java:37)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.execute(SessionImpl.java:2464)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.executeAll(SessionImpl.java:2450)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.execute(SessionImpl.java:2407)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.flush(SessionImpl.java:2276)
	at net.sf.hibernate.transaction.JDBCTransaction.commit(JDBCTransaction.java:61)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(HibernateTransactionManager.java:510)
	... 17 more{code}

h4. Cause

A group membership is being synchronised from the remote directory which already exists, and Confluence is attempting to add this. There are a few reasons why the remote directory would synchronise such memberships, including but not limited to the following known bugs:

| CONF-28190 | Adding a user to a group locally on Confluence when using a read/write remote Crowd or JIRA directory |
| CWD-3147 | If a user exists in two directories in an application, and is added to a group in one directory that it was already in the other, clients get duplicate key errors |

h4. Workaround

Flushing the cache of the directory will stop the error from happening, and cause the directory to synchronise fully, until the next time a duplicate group membership is sent from the remote directory. The simplest way of forcing this is:

# Disable the directory
# Enable the directory

For the specific causes there may be workarounds in the linked bug tickets.
fields.summary: Confluence attempts to apply group memberships when synchronising from a remote directory even if they already exist, causing a duplicate key violation

h3. Workaround to fix the error
# Log in with an internal administrator account
# Edit the properties of the directory
# Set it to Read Only
# Save and sync
# Edit the directory again and set it back to Read/Write
# Sync again
#- Observe that the group membership has synced to JIRA, and there are no more failures
# If this doesn't work, you can disable the current directory and set up another one, after making the user's membership changes in JIRA if required.

h3. Ongoing Workaround 
Make all user and group changes in the external directory, not in Confluence itself.

fields.description: When there are a large number of items in the index queue (~170,000) flushing the entire queue loads all those index queue entries into the one hibernate session, making indexing really grind to a halt.  The flush entire queue should ensure that the hibernate session does not grow too large, and should loop in batches using an inner transaction and flushing the session.

        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Create a new page
2. Add an image with "+" and/or "&"in name (see attachements)
3. Select the image and add an effect on it
4. Nothing happens (see screenshot)
5. When cancelled, the image is broken in editor

The problem does not persists if no mod_proxy is used, however if Confluence is set up according to the following, it will cause the symptoms above: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Using+Apache+with+mod_proxy]

*Potential workarounds*
- Use Confluence without reverse proxy.
- The image can be renamed to not have + or & sign in the name.
- Remove mod_proxy.
- And we can add nocanon to the reverse proxy, like this, so that + and & are not encoded:
{code}
ProxyPass / http://localhost:8090 nocanon
{code}
fields.summary: Images with '&' '+' characters in the filename will cause image effects to fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28179].
  {panel}

Some users wish to "watch" individual attachments, and be notified of changes, without having to watch an entire page.

For example, on a collaborative page that houses ten attachments, a user watching the page would be notified any time any of the ten attachments are changed, as well as any time the core page itself is modified. But all the user wants is to keep track of attachment A and be notified of its changes.

The question was posed on Atlassian Answers, and the recommendation was to set up an RSS to track the labels of the attachments. This is not quite going to achieve what we are looking for.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/134973/is-it-possible-to-watch-an-individual-attachment-rather-than-an-entire-page
fields.summary: Add "Watch" functionality to individual attachments
Add default paragraph text to color schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28177].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

Although we do provide a detailed information regarding [User Management Limitation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+Management+Limitations+and+Recommendations] there are customer who does not aware of such limitation and integrate Confluence against a huge user base on their LDAP server.

This implementation can cause Confluence synchronization to run forever which could be avoided if a synchronization time limit is implemented and configurable by the administrators.

Another cause of unstoppable synchronization is due to corrupted cache.
fields.summary: Provide Option to Limit Directory Synchronization Time

fields.description:
When using "@" mentions in Confluence, Dashboard All Updates normally display only the username (not the actual name). If the actual name contains any non Latin characters, Confluence then replaces username with the actual name..

Repro steps:
# Create an username.
# In the actual name, introduce a string containing non latin characters, i.e.: _John Stærk_
# Add comment to a page, with a mention to _John Stærk_ and any other user whose name contains only Latin characters.
# Go to the dashboard and check All Updates. _John Stærk_ is displayed while only the username (and not the actual name) is displayed for the other user.
fields.summary: All Updates replaces username with actual name in mentions only when the username has non latin characters
Please enable fit to width for enlarged image.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28166].
  {panel}

OnDemand users are not able to create user macros.  However, Atlassian recommends in their documentation to use a NoPrint macro to create content that should not be in an export. 

The export to PDF option is used often for creating customer-facing documentation.  However, not having the noprint doesn't allow a write to keep content together, with some content only pertinent for employees such as configuration, support, or implementation teams. 

Not having this requires us to create and maintain separate document which disrupts the flow and can be confusing. 

It would also address the current issue with the NoPrint attribute on the TOC being broken. We use the TOC often to assist with online navigation; but, it is not always appropriate to have this in exported, client-facing documentation. This would provide a workaround for this current bug.
fields.summary: Provide a 'NoPrint macro' in Confluence

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Drill down to a comment notification in Workbox
# Click "Reply"
# Click "Cancel"
# Click "Reply"

Expected behaviour: 
Textarea should be displayed for replying.

Actual behaviour: 
The *Reply* link/button greyish and the Text area does not display.

Workaround:
Refresh the browser and open up the Workbox notification again to reply.

Your Current Enabled Dark Features:
site-wide.shared-drafts, site-wide.synchrony, editor.page-layout, federated.search, rotp.admin.shortcuts, editor.breadcrumbs, editor.chunky.tips, heatmapper, dailysummary.weekly.disable, rotp.project.shortcuts, ondemand.marketplace.prototype, experiment.editor.quickcomment
fields.summary: Cannot cancel and open reply again when replying to a comment in Workbox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28164].
  {panel}

We should add a 'Plugin Upgrades' section in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Confluence+5+FAQ to note that Gliffy and Balsamiq will be getting upgraded along with 5.0 and give the new version numbers.

h5. Gliffy
Gliffy hasn't changed majorly, we can just note version and link to their notes.
* Upgraded to Gliffy v 5.0.4
* Link to full release notes: http://www.gliffy.com/products/confluence-plugin/download/archive/release_notes.php?releaseId=92

h5. Balsmaiq
* With the removal of the 'Add' menu, Balsmaiq Mockups can now be inserted from the 'Insert' menu inside the editor.
* This now launches you straight into Balsmaiq where you can create and save your mockup, then finish editing the page and save it.
* To edit a mockup, instead of using the 'Edit Mockup' link on the page, you can now Edit the page and then double click the mockup or select edit from the contextual menu that appears when the mockup us selected.
fields.summary: New versions of Gliffy & Balsamiq in OnDemand with 5.0

fields.description:
Confluence 4.3 source did contain the source for this plugin, but later versions do not.

h3. Root cause

There is currently a problem with the Confluence source distribution plugin not including bundled plugins source code in the distribution.

h3. Observed issue
Some missing source code includes:
# Certain bundled plugins
# confluence-space-ia plugin
# Confluence-basic-macros
# Inline Comments plugin
# Content Report Table macro
# confluence-search-plugin

h3. Workaround

Bundled plugin source code is available for all commercial customers of Confluence on request. Please raise a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com/contact with the plugin and version number of the source code you need, and our team will provide an export of that version from our internal systems.
fields.summary: Confluence source distribution doesn't contain certain source code
Provide a Windows 8 app for Confluence Mobile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28154].
  {panel}

For internal consistency, if a user creates a Web Link, but points towards the Confluence's own base url Confluence should convert the web link to an internal style confluence link.

example:
User inserts *{{http://baseurl/wiki/space/page}}*
Confluence converts to: *{{Space/Page}}*
internally styled link, so that moves and changes in the page will be kept in the stored link.
fields.summary: Automatically Convert web links pointing to Confluence itself.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28149].
  {panel}

For our dev project we use both Jira and Confluence, and we recently started with linking Jira issues to pages in Confluence. 

SSO is achieved through Atlassian Crowd.

The first time I logged in in Confluence, I got a notification on Jira Authentication. When I want to authorise, I get an authentication failure: 
(See also attached images.)

Authentication failed!
An error occurred while trying to obtain an access token. For application link "wiki (0d5c5996-31e3-3f45-bd44-1951ddef3d43) https://wiki.ctmmtrait.nl com.atlassian.applinks.application.confluence.ConfluenceApplicationTypeImpl@1f4f102d"
fields.summary: Authentication failure for 'JIRA asking authentication to create notifications in Confluence'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28148].
  {panel}

Dear,

We would like to create a structured dashboard page in which projects are structured/related to each other.

- project A
--subproject A1
---comon header page
---detail pages
--subproject A2
---common header page
---detail pages
- project B
--subproject B1
---common header page
---detail pages

Project A1 and B1 are based on the same project template definition. subproject A2 is based on another project template definition.

Depending on the user permissions, the user can see project A and project B or only one of them but with the full sublevels.

Project A1 and B1 has the same pagenames, the header part of those projects contains the same structure.

So, I think, we have to define all the projects on the same level but is there a way to 'manipulate' the dashboard in order to create some kind of structure or categorisation of the projects?

Thank you in advance for your feedback.
fields.summary: Confluence Dashboard page
Remove Mentions Java level dependency on Confluence Rest Code

When copying a space using the copy space plugin (https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/CPSP), a NullPointerException is thrown because the PageUpdateEvent published by the DefaultContentEntityManager does not contain the original version of the page.

Relevant source locations:

Copy Space plugin 
com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.copyspace.DefaultCopySpaceManager, line 191:
{{pageManager.saveContentEntity(copy, null);}}

com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentEntityManager, line 52:
{{publishUpdateEvent(obj, null, saveContext);}}
com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager, line 803:
{{eventManager.publishEvent(new PageUpdateEvent(this, (Page) obj, (Page) origObj));}}

com.atlassian.labs.mentions.ConfluenceMentionsEventListener, lines 215-216:
{code}
        Iterable<String> usernames = mentionFinder.getNewMentionedUsernames(originalContent.getBodyContent(),

fields.summary: NPE in mentions event handler when using the copy space plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28145].
  {panel}

When I mention someone in a comment, I often want to write something like:

bq. "[Sam|http://google.com], what kind of home brews do you planned for summer?"

But it actually autocompletes to the full name like:

bq. "[Sam Haldane|http://google.com], what kind of home brews..."

It would be ideal if we autocompleted to just the first name in comments. Since comments are a conversation, rarely do you mention or address someone by their full name. While lurking in the HipChat room for FedEx 18 (see screenshot below), I noticed they do this nicely.

If you look at their [documentation|https://www.hipchat.com/help/page/how-do-mentions-work], they describe how it works:
bq. By default we will use someone's first name "@john". If there are two Johns, we will use their full name @"John Smith" to correctly identify them.

!https://img.skitch.com/20111027-g1xtq5b7y2cttc9xu1xem85hd1.jpg!
fields.summary: Autocomplete just the first name for @mentions in comments
Make mentions work in plain text comments
Make mention tip in email notification more noticeable

fields.summary: Make Mention notifications more consistent with standard Confluence notifications
Show mention events in the activity stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28140].
  {panel}

Specifically:

* Disable them completely (e.g. in Email Settings under profile)
* Disable particular users (e.g. to ignore spam from Project Managers)

Other possibilities, are to digest mentions to be daily instead of instant.
fields.summary: Have the ability to opt out of mentions or be in a daily digest format (section in notifications settings).
Include page and blog post content excerpts in mention email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28137].
  {panel}

This is a nice-to-have:

The behaviour would work similar to the share button:

!20110317-cfu73ejh51t751g7pbm6gf9ku8.png!

If you mention a user by email, it sends them a link.

Also see how Google docs does it http://googledocs.blogspot.com/2011/03/introducing-discussions-in-google-docs.html

!20110317-nppjc96f3mp7fqu589gjknc6ur.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28123].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a space with no root page. (Move or delete the default page)
2. Request the space through the REST API with the expand=rootpages parameter.

On all other REST requests, using the expand parameter on an element that has no children (like expand attachments on a page with no attachments) works as expected. However, on a space with no root page, expanding rootpages gets a 500 error with a stack trace and the message "Start of page can not be a negative number: -1".

fields.summary: Using expand=rootpages parameter on a space with no root pages gets a 500 error

fields.description:
If an user navigates to a page that has any kind of individual "editing" restriction but is of public view and then clicks on the padlock icon, he or she will see the Names, Uids of the users who are mentioned in the "edit" restriction or any groups part if the restriction.

We think it is wrong to
- Expose uids and groups names, which are not exposed to anonymous users anywhere else.
- Expose who can edit the page to anonymous users. The way we see it this is quite private information.
fields.summary: Anonymous users can see page restriction data, exposing user ids and group names

fields.description:
h4. Problem description When the user macro has too large string as its parameter, the user macro fail to render in Confluence editor. If the user macro is successfully rendered to page editor, and edit that user macro again while adding more characters, it will go to infinite loading. However when the string parameter is already too large, the user macro won't be able to be rendered to editor, it will just disappear. {quote} *Please note that:* This character limits depends on the environment, therefore on each Confluence, it might behave differently. In my local instance it was 5707 characters, on my colleague's Confluence the limit was 5785 character, on customer's Confluence it was 5640 {quote} h4. How to replicate # Navigate to create user macro from _Browse >> Confluence Admin >> User Macros_ # Create user macro, put any name and title, and leave everything as default. _Make sure that *Macro Body Processing* option is at *No Macro body* option_ # Put the following as macro template {code} ## @param Test:title=Test|type=string|required=false

#if($paramTest) Parameter Test length: $paramTest.length() #else Parameter Test length: 0 #end

$!paramTest

{code} # Go to Confluence page editor and add the user macro just newly created # Get very large text, say 30,000 characters length and add it as the macro parameter # Click refresh to preview the macro (should be working on this stage) # Add the macro to the page by clicking _Save_ button, and notice that the macro won't be rendered
fields.summary: Unable to render user macro if the length of the string parameter is too large

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a file that contains spaces in its filename (e.g. "good snippets.txt") to a Confluence page
# Copy the attachment's URL in Confluence (should be something like this: http://localhost:8437/download/attachments/65537/good%20snippets.txt?api=v2 )
# Paste the link to an Excel document, then try to click on the link in the Excel document

Notice that the link first goes to http://localhost:8437/login.action?os_destination=%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F65537%2Fgood+snippets.txt%3Fapi%3Dv2 , then gets redirected immediately to the dashboard

h3.Cause
The space in the attachment is not properly encoded, during the login redirect. Notice that the space is encoded as "+" instead of "%2B". The same behavior is not seen in Confluence 3.5, which has the same login redirect, but in Confluence 3.5, the space is encoded correctly:
http://localhost:8354/login.action?os_destination=%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F65537%2Fgood%2Bsnippets.txt%3Fapi%3Dv2 . Changing it to "+" in Confluence 3.5 results in the same dashboard redirect behavior.

Note that the login redirect will occur even if you have an active session in the browser. It will not however, prompt you for a username and password if you already have an active session

h3.Workaround
Copy the link in Excel, and paste it into the browser's address bar manually - accessing the attachment this way will not get you redirected to the dashboard
fields.summary: Attachment links from external sources with spaces in their filename redirects to dashboard

fields.description:
h4. Problem description
When the heading and preceded by table afterwards, can't be selected using mouse, when the heading and table is inside macro body. The selection will somehow disappear when dragging the mouse to select the heading and table, cause user unable both heading and table together.

h4. Steps to replicate
# Open Confluence page editor, by editing or adding a page.
# Create a panel macro, and put a heading followed by table, like the following screenshot.
!heading-table.png!
# Select the heading and the table together using mouse
# Notice that somehow the selection will disappear as you drag the mouse down

h4. Workaround
Use keyboard selection instead. Put the cursor at the beginning of heading, and press _Shift_ button followed by the arrow button.
fields.summary: Unable to select using mouse on heading and table together inside a macro
